H0.text: What English city was originally built by the Romans as a spa in 60 A.D.. York

H1.text: What English city was originally built by the Romans as a spa in 60 A.D.. Chester

H2.text: What English city was originally built by the Romans as a spa in 60 A.D.. Cheltenham

H3.text: What English city was originally built by the Romans as a spa in 60 A.D.. Bath

A4.text: The city became a spa with the Latin name Aquae Sulis ('the waters of Sulis') c. 60 AD when the Romans built baths and a temple in the valley of the River Avon

A5.text: Bath is a city in Somerset, England, known for and named after its Roman-built baths
